bestBHT.bht: They had never personally seen Jesus hungry, thirsty, or as a stranger, but they understood that they had served him in these ways by ministering to those in need. Although they hadn't witnessed Christ himself in such circumstances, they recognized the importance of extending kindness and generosity to others, considering it as if they were doing it directly for him.

John Gill: As they had never seen him hungry and thirsty, in his own person, though he was both in the days of his flesh, and were ministered to, both by angels, and by good women out of their substance..

so they had never seen him a stranger, and took him into their houses; yet they had, seen him hungry and thirsty, and as a stranger in his members, and had done these good offices to him in them, and to them for his sake.
for so Christ in person never was, until stripped of his raiment by the soldiers, and officers; but they had seen many of his poor saints without clothing, and had covered their nakedness.

bhtAttempts.bht: These commentators emphasize that the people in this verse had never personally witnessed Jesus hungry, thirsty, or as a stranger in their own lives, but they had recognized Him in others who were in need. They had ministered to Him and shown hospitality to Him by taking care of His followers who were hungry, thirsty, and without clothing. Although they may not have directly encountered Jesus Himself, they had demonstrated their love and compassion for Him by extending kindness and support to those in need.

Those who did not see Jesus in person still recognized Him in others who were hungry, thirsty, and in need. They ministered to Him, demonstrating their love and compassion for Him by extending kindness and support to those in need. Though they never directly encountered Jesus Himself, they understood that caring for His followers was equivalent to caring for Him. Their actions reflected their recognition of Jesus in the faces of those who were hungry, thirsty, and without clothing.

They had never personally seen Jesus hungry, thirsty, or as a stranger, but they understood that they had served him in these ways by ministering to those in need. Although they hadn't witnessed Christ himself in such circumstances, they recognized the importance of extending kindness and generosity to others, considering it as if they were doing it directly for him.

The verse conveys the message that the righteous cared for Christ by attending to the needs of the hungry, thirsty, and strangers. Although they may not have physically encountered Christ in these circumstances, they recognized that by serving those in need, they were serving Christ himself. This passage emphasizes the importance of showing love and compassion to others, recognizing that in doing so, we are ultimately serving and caring for Christ.

The righteous demonstrated their care for Christ by fulfilling the needs of the hungry, thirsty, and strangers. Even though they didn't directly encounter Christ in these situations, they understood that by aiding those in need, they were essentially aiding Christ himself. This highlights the significance of expressing love and empathy towards others, as it signifies our devotion and compassion towards Christ.
